github_commits.author: Rahul Sharma
github_commits.message: Fix: Implemented separate retention policies for S3 buckets. Addressing production issue.
github_commits.lessons_learned: Learned that explicit configuration is key for retention policies. Need clearer documentation.
github_commits.bug_related: Directly addresses the bug regarding inconsistent retention times across environments.

github_commits.author: Priya Sharma
github_commits.message: Minor adjustments to the retention policy implementation. Added logging.
github_commits.lessons_learned: Logging is crucial for debugging retention issues.  Need to ensure logs are structured properly.
github_commits.bug_related: Further refinement of the fix, improving monitoring capabilities.

slack_conversations.thread_title: Discussion about Fix and remediation - Retention Policy Chaos!

messages.author: Rahul
messages.text: Yaar, Fix and remediation pe kaam karna hai.  S3 mein data retention bahut confusion hai, bhai!  It's a total mess.

messages.author: Priya
messages.text: Haan bhai, main dekh rahi hoon.  Ye retention policy toh seriously, it's a disaster!

messages.author: Amit
messages.text: Theek hai, let me check the code and see how it's configured.  Let's try to get a handle on this.

messages.author: Neha
messages.text: Arrey, ye issue production mein aayega kya?  If we mess this up, it'll be a huge problem.  Let's be careful!

messages.author: Rahul
messages.text: Nahi yaar, testing mein catch kar lenge.  We'll test everything thoroughly before deploying.  Testing, testing, testing!

slack_conversations.key_decisions: Decided to implement separate retention policies for S3 buckets based on data sensitivity.
slack_conversations.warnings: Warning: Potential for data loss if retention policies are not correctly configured.  Double-check everything!
slack_conversations.bug_clues: Rahul mentioned 'data retention bahut confusion' ‚Äì a key indicator of the problem.

jira_tickets.title: Implement Fix and remediation - S3 Retention Policy
jira_tickets.description: Implement separate retention policies for S3 buckets to address inconsistencies and potential data loss.  Focus on clarity and auditability.  Requires detailed documentation and thorough testing.
comments: Update 1: Initial setup of retention policies complete.  Waiting for testing results.
Update 2: Testing confirms no data loss.  Documentation updated.
jira_tickets.bug_connection: Directly related to the bug impacting data retention across environments.

confluence_docs.title: S3 Retention Policy Implementation - Sprint 6
confluence_docs.content:
## S3 Retention Policy Implementation

This document outlines the steps taken to implement separate retention policies for S3 buckets.  The goal is to ensure data is retained for the correct duration based on its sensitivity.  See also: [Link to S3 Configuration Guide]
confluence_docs.author: Sneha Patel

google_docs.title: Sprint 6 Planning - Retention Policy Fix
google_docs.content:
## Sprint 6 Planning - Retention Policy Fix

**Attendees:** Rahul, Priya, Amit, Arjun

**Action Items:**
* Rahul: Finalize S3 configuration changes.
* Priya: Create documentation for the new retention policies.
* Arjun: Conduct thorough testing.

**Decisions Made:**
* Separate retention policies will be implemented for different S3 buckets based on data sensitivity.
* Documentation will be created to ensure proper configuration and maintenance.

**Bug Mentions:** Reference to TECH-601 ‚Äì S3 Retention Policy Bug
action_items: Priya: Create documentation for the new retention policies.
decisions_made: Separate retention policies will be implemented for different S3 buckets based on data sensitivity.
Documentation will be created to ensure proper configuration and maintenance.
google_docs.bug_mentions: Reference to TECH-601 ‚Äì S3 Retention Policy Bug
